intro: Thesium brachygyne, commonly known as the narrow-fruit thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and yellowish to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are often narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, dry fruits. Thesium brachygyne is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
